title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt over time. This repository provides a simple, user-friendly interface to track sleep patterns and visualize the accumulated difference between desired and actual sleep, offering insights into improving sleep habits. The project serves as a practical example of utilizing TypeScript in a front-end application.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project template built with Next.js 14 utilizing the pages router, TypeScript, and MUI for a robust and modern development experience. It serves as a starting point for new projects, incorporating best practices and demonstrating the use of React Query for efficient data fetching and management. This repository showcases a practical application of TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript within the Next.js ecosystem.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a web application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript designed as a project to explore voting mechanisms and user interfaces. The repository encompasses code related to handling user authentication, vote casting, and displaying real-time results, providing a foundation for building interactive voting systems and exploring related UI/UX patterns.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface built with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, with supporting Python backend scripts, to visualize and interact with Robofleet data. This project focuses on creating a dynamic dashboard for monitoring and controlling robotic fleets, enabling real-time insights and management functionalities.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern dashboard application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It serves as a practical example for implementing robust UI components, data fetching strategies, and dynamic routing within a Next.js environment, focusing on common project-related functionalities.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, it provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and explore log data, making it easier to debug and understand ROS system behavior. This project falls under the broader category of ROS tools and development.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains Python-based Jupyter Notebook projects exploring financial analysis and modeling techniques. Leveraging Python libraries, the projects cover various finance-related topics, providing practical examples and implementations for learning and experimentation in quantitative finance.

title: resume
description: This repository houses my resume, meticulously crafted using LaTeX for professional formatting and potentially complemented with an HTML version for online accessibility. The project showcases my skills and experience in a clean and organized manner, serving as a central element in my professional portfolio.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project utilizing HTML and Python to create interactive and insightful map visualizations. This repository contains code for generating and displaying geographic data on maps, focusing on data representation and user-friendly interfaces for exploring geospatial information.

title: jovian
description: The jovian repository houses a full-stack CRUD application built with Python and Flask, leveraging PostgreSQL for data persistence.  It demonstrates a practical project incorporating HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, providing a working example for those interested in learning or implementing CRUD functionalities, web application development, and database interaction with Python.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web-based project built with TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, and Vitejs that leverages Express.js and the Gemini API to facilitate interactive and engaging conversations. This repository showcases a practical application of modern web technologies and provides a foundation for exploring AI-powered communication solutions.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript, CSS, and HTML-based project focused on creating a dynamic and interactive event calendar. It provides a user-friendly interface for displaying and managing events, offering features like date selection, event listing, and potentially event creation or editing, all within a web-based environment. This repository serves as a practical example of front-end web development techniques and event management principles.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, leveraging Supabase for backend services and Tailwind CSS for styling. This repository demonstrates a modern, full-stack approach to IoT asset tracking, showcasing best practices in project structure and utilizing technologies related to nextjs, supabase, and tailwindcss.

title: atg-world
description: The `atg-world` repository houses a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This project, classified under the "project" topic, leverages modern web technologies to deliver its functionality. Further details about the specific purpose and features of this project can be found within the repository.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project board application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to help users brainstorm, organize, and track their ideas. This project provides a visual and interactive workspace for managing concepts from initial inspiration to fully-fledged project plans. The repository showcases modern web development practices and offers a flexible platform for personal or collaborative idea management.

title: fruit-seller
description: fruit-seller is a Next.js 14 e-commerce project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, showcasing a modern web application architecture using the pages-router. It leverages MUI for UI components and React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, demonstrating type-safe development practices for a scalable and maintainable storefront.
